result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor V Segura

records.addlTxt: Defense counsel requested adjournment due to needing more time for review. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 04. Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Driscoll.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.

Defendant Victor V Segura appeared by video.  Attorney Anthony D Cotton appeared by video for Victor V Segura.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Motion filed by defense. Hearing held. Court hears argument.  Court DENIES defense motion.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Dismiss Defective Complaint, filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 078808,
Payable Number: 1026287,
Receipt Number: 22RP032920,
Amount: $20.00

ADDRESS INFO for Victor V Segura
Current: 4335 N 104th Street Apt 204, Milwaukee, WI 53222 United States  (Effective: 08-16-2022)
Prior: 3745 West Wells Street #109, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Defendant Victor V Segura in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests this matter be set for status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Victor V Segura not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appears in person the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring: NO CONTACT ORDER.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Victor V Segura in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Victor V Segura in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victor V Segura appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defendant's eligibility depends on employment. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Tracy A.G.; Elizabeth B., Anthony J.M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
